doc.title: J.P.Morgan
doc.source_uri: 2025-12-31/Bank of Beijing - A 2Q25 Mixed Profits beat while NIM missed. Capital position may restrict the stability of dividend po_2025-12-31

passages.text: 2Q25 Mixed - Profits because while NIM missed. Capital position may restrict the stability of dividend policy

2Q25 Mixed. BoBJ's 2Q profit was \(+5\%\) y/y, beating JPME by \(3\%\) . On the positive side, we like: 1) Improvements in the core earnings trend, with 2Q NII \(+4\%\) y/y and fee income \(+15\%\) y/y; 2) NPL% remained stable q/q, and forward looking AQ indicators (SML and overdue ratios) both declined h/h. The company did not disclose the trend on retail AQ, where peers are seeing rising pressure. On the negative side, BoBJ's 1H25 NIM contraction (- 16bps h/h) is larger than expected, and the trend is worse than CRB peers (- 6bps h/h for covered CBRs on average). In addition, its CET1 ratio was only 84bps above the regulatory minimum requirement, which may restrict the stability of its dividend policies. No interim dividend in 1H25 is disappointing to yield investors. We expect a muted to slightly negative market reaction given the capital pressure and lagging NIM trend. Maintain Neutral.

- Core earnings growth trend improved in 2Q. 2Q25 NII growth (+4% y/y) turned positive from a -1% y/y contraction in 1Q25. 2Q fee income was +15% y/y, supported by settlement fees and agency fees. On a semi-annual basis, settlement fees +31% y/y and agency fees +10% y/y.

- Asset quality metrics showed positive signs. In 2Q25 the NPL ratio stayed flat q/q. On an semi-annual-basis, forward-looking AQ indicators delivered fine-tuning messages. The SML ratio dropped by -29bps h/h and the overdue ratio decreased by -9bps h/h. However, the 2Q NPL coverage ratio declined slightly by 2.4pcts q/q, and the bank's NPL coverage ratio at 195.7% is relatively low among our covered regional banks. This may suggest limited room for provision management to cushion growth in future.

- NIM contraction was larger than expected. 1H25 NIM dropped - 16bps/h to 1.31%, which is -7bps lower than our expectation. The magnitude of NIM contraction was larger than previous periods (0bps h/h in 2H24 and -8bps h/h in 1H24). The loan yield saw a significant contraction of -47bps h/h in 1H25, dragging overall asset yield down by -41bps h/h. The funding cost only decreased by -25bps in the same period.

- Capital ratios further deteriorated. In 2Q25, the CET1 ratio further dropped by -5bps q/q to 8.59%. Note that the CET1 ratio was only 84bps above the regulatory's minimum CET1% requirement for a bucket 1 D-SIB (7.75%). The capital position may restrict its business expansion and the stability of its dividend policy.

J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

- **No interim dividend in 1H25.** The company did not announce an interim dividend in 1H25 (vs an 18% interim payout ratio in 1H24). We believe this is restricted by its thin capital buffer. The dividend policy will likely be perceived as a mild negative by yield investors.

- **Cost-to-income ratio increased.** We calculate the 1H25 cost-to-income ratio increased by 78bps h/h. BoBJ’s cost-to-income ratio has started to pick up since 2020. An increase in staff cost (+9% y/y) was the key driver for +4% y/y OPEX in 1H, while revenue was only up 1% y/y.

- BoBJ offers attractive shareholder returns, and has maintained its dividend payout ratio at over \(30\%\) since FY17. However, its relatively low capital position may restrict its future payouts, though this could be partly mitigated by positive internal capital generation against RWA growth.- Long-term weaker profitability, as evidenced by lower PPoP over average assets and lower RoRWA due to poorer risk-adjusted returns and a depressed loan-deposit ratio, are likely to be a drag on ROE.- Higher asset quality risks due to surging NPL formation and weaker provision ratios will likely continue to weigh on earnings growth upside.
Our Dec- 25 price target of Rmb6.40 is based on DDM, assuming a cost of equity of \(11.5\%\) , normalized ROE of \(7.4\%\) and a terminal date of 31 December 2027.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P.
